ground_truth: Henry turns and grips the mounted machine gun with a perplexed expression and then pulls out his watch. Indy uses his arm to demonstrate that he's referring to a direction and not a time. Henry does as indicated, and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight. He pulls back on the trigger, causing the machine gun to fire repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left, but Henry keeps it in his gun sight. Henry inadvertently swings the gun around, while Indy looks back at the missing tail section, then at his father. The plane begins to go down, and Indy struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control, the plane skids and crashes first into a corral of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond, sending a cloud of dust into the air. Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as guns blaze and bullets explode around them; Indy and Henry jump over a stone barricade. Henry, frightened, grabs at Indy as an old man kneels at his car repairing a rear tire. The man turns to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands, and suddenly the wheel moves forward, startling him. Indy has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel, while Henry is a very nervous passenger. Indy sees a low-flying Messerschmidt coming up behind him in the side mirror, and as it roars by overhead, bullets explode around them, narrowly missing the car. The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep, and the Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car with machine guns firing, but the car enters the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel, shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun, with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames, Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single under-fuselage bomb, which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb, and Indy climbs out, still in the bomb crater, and turns back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Henry rotates and clutches the fixed automatic weapon with a bewildered expression and then extracts his timepiece. Indy employs his limb to illustrate that he's alluding to a direction and not a time. Henry complies as directed, and the erupting firearm nearly jostles him out of his chair as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his view. He tugs back on the lever, prompting the automatic weapon to discharge repeatedly as the Messerschmidt tilts to the left, but Henry maintains it in his weapon sight. Henry inadvertently swivels the gun around, while Indy glances back at the absent tail section, then at his father. The aircraft commences to descend, and Indy battles to govern its descent until the wheels make contact. Out of control, the aircraft skids and collides first into a pen of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond, sending a cloud of dust into the atmosphere. Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as firearms blaze and projectiles erupt around them; Indy and Henry leap over a stone barrier. Henry, terrified, seizes at Indy as an elderly man crouches at his automobile repairing a rear tire. The man rotates to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands, and suddenly the wheel progresses forward, startling him. Indy has the accelerator down, both hands firmly grasping the steering wheel, while Henry is a very anxious passenger. Indy observes a low-flying Messerschmidt advancing up behind him in the side mirror, and as it thunders by overhead, projectiles erupt around them, narrowly missing the vehicle. The vehicle races toward a passageway that cuts through a steep, and the Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's automobile with automatic weapons firing, but the automobile enters the passageway. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and crashes into the entrance of the passageway, shearing off its wings. The burning fuselage continues to surge through the passageway like a projectile down the barrel of a firearm, with sparks flying as its underside scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the passageway. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The vehicle exits the passageway at top speed and swerves off the road as the burning Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the vehicle emerges safely from the flames, Henry wipes the perspiration from his forehead and gazes out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its singular under-fuselage explosive, which erupts in the road directly ahead of the vehicle, missing it by only several feet. The vehicle falls into the cavity made by the explosive, and Indy climbs out, still in the explosive crater, and rotates back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Henry turns and the mounted machine gun is gripped by him with a perplexed expression and then his watch is pulled out. Indy uses his arm to demonstrate that a direction is being referred to and not a time. Henry does as indicated, and he is nearly shaken out of his seat by the exploding gun as one of the Messerschmidts is in his sight. The trigger is pulled back by him, causing the machine gun to be fired repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left, but it is kept in his gun sight by Henry. The gun is inadvertently swung around by Henry, while back is looked at by Indy at the missing tail section, then his father. The plane begins to go down, and the descent is struggled to be controlled by Indy until the wheels are touched down. Out of control, the plane skids and first crashes into a corral of goats and then is crashed into the farmhouse beyond, sending a cloud of dust into the air. The cockpit is pulled from by Indy as guns blaze and bullets explode around them; the stone barricade is jumped over by Indy and Henry. Indy is grabbed at by Henry, frightened, as an old man kneels at his car repairing a rear tire. The wheel is turned to by the man, the hubcap in his hands, and he is startled as the wheel suddenly moves forward. The throttle is down by Indy, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel, while a very nervous passenger is Henry. A low-flying Messerschmidt is seen by Indy coming up behind him in the side mirror, and as it roars by overhead, bullets explode around them, narrowly missing the car. The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep, and Indy's car is borne down on by the Messerschmidt with machine guns firing, but the tunnel is entered by the car. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel, shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to be rocketed through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun, with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders and see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The tunnel is exited by the car at top speed and the road is veered off as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames, the sweat is wiped from Henry's brow, and out the windshield is looked by him to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The single under-fuselage bomb is dropped by the Messerschmidt, which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet. The bomb's crater is fallen into by the car, and Indy climbs out, still in the bomb crater, and back is turned to Henry by him.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Henry turns, grips the mounted machine gun with a puzzled look, and checks his watch. Indy clarifies he's indicating a direction, not a time. Henry follows the cue, firing the machine gun at a Messerschmidt, nearly getting shaken from his seat. He inadvertently swings the gun, while Indy notices their missing tail section. The plane descends uncontrollably, skidding into a goat corral and crashing into a farmhouse. Indy exits the cockpit amid gunfire; he and Henry leap over a stone wall. Henry, scared, clings to Indy as an old man repairs a tire nearby. The wheel shifts, surprising him as Indy speeds ahead, grasping the steering wheel. They spot a low-flying Messerschmidt in the mirror, narrowly dodging its bullets. Racing toward a tunnel, the Messerschmidt can't pull up and crashes, losing its wings. The flaming fuselage rockets through, sparks flying, nearly overtaking their car. They exit the tunnel, avoiding the explosion. Henry wipes sweat as another Messerschmidt drops a bomb, creating a crater. The car falls in, and Indy climbs out, turning back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Henry grips the machine gun with confusion, then checks his watch. Indy signals it's about direction, not time. Henry follows, the gun shakes him as he targets a Messerschmidt. He fires repeatedly, keeping it in sight as it banks left. The gun swings, and Indy sees the missing tail and then his father. The plane descends uncontrollably, crashing into a goat corral and a farmhouse, raising dust. Indy exits as gunfire surrounds them, and they jump over a stone wall. Henry, scared, grabs Indy while an old man repairs a tire. Suddenly, the wheel startles the man. Indy drives with Henry nervously beside him as a Messerschmidt attacks. Bullets miss the car, which speeds into a tunnel. The Messerschmidt crashes at the tunnel's entrance, and its fuselage rockets through, scraping sides. Indy and Henry see it closing in but escape as the wreck explodes. Henry wipes sweat as another Messerschmidt bombs the road. The car falls into the crater, Indy climbs out, and turns to Henry.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Henry, with a perplexed expression etched across his face, turns his attention towards the mounted machine gun, gripping it firmly. He then pulls out his watch and examines it intently. Indy, using his arm as a makeshift pointer, gestures to clarify that he is referring to a direction and not indicating any particular time. Henry follows the direction as indicated, and suddenly, the gun erupts with explosive energy, nearly dislodging him from his seat as one of the elusive Messerschmitts comes within his sights. With resolve, he pulls back on the trigger, causing the machine gun to unleash a barrage of fire. The Messerschmitt banks sharply to the left, yet Henry manages to keep it within his gun sight. Inadvertently, Henry swings the gun around, while Indy turns to look back at the missing tail section, then back at his father with concern. The airplane begins to descend rapidly, and Indy struggles to regain control and stabilize its descent until the wheels finally make contact with the ground. Out of control, the plane skids wildly, crashing first into a corral of unsuspecting goats and then into the farmhouse just beyond, sending a massive cloud of dust into the air. 

Indy hastily pulls himself from the cockpit amidst a storm of gunfire and exploding bullets surrounding them; both Indy and Henry quickly leap over a sturdy stone barricade for cover. Henry, visibly frightened, clings to Indy as an elderly man is seen kneeling beside his car, diligently repairing a rear tire. The man turns his attention to the wheel, with the hubcap in his hands, and is suddenly startled as the wheel unexpectedly rolls forward. Indy, with determination, pushes the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel, while Henry sits beside him, a very nervous passenger. Indy notices a low-flying Messerschmitt advancing from behind, visible in the side mirror, and as it roars overhead, bullets explode dangerously close, narrowly missing the car. The car hurtles toward a tunnel cutting through a steep path, with the Messerschmitt bearing down menacingly on Indy's car, machine guns relentlessly firing. However, at the last moment, the car enters the tunnel. Unable to adjust in time, the Messerschmitt slams violently into the mouth of the tunnel, stripping off its wings. The flaming fuselage rockets through the tunnel like a bullet being shot from the muzzle of a gun, sparks flying as it scrapes against the pavement and the enclosing tunnel walls.

Indy and Henry glance over their shoulders, their eyes widening as the wingless ball of fire rapidly gains on them, threatening to overtake their vehicle. The car bursts out of the tunnel at top speed, veering off the road just as the flaming Messerschmitt fuselage shoots past them and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges unscathed from the blazing inferno, Henry wipes the sweat from his brow, relieved, and looks out the windshield, only to see another Messerschmitt screaming out of the sky towards them. The advancing Messerschmitt releases its single under-fuselage bomb, which detonates on the road just ahead of the car, missing them by mere feet. The car plunges into the bomb-created crater, and Indy climbs out, still within the confines of the crater, turning back towards Henry.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Henry, his face a canvas of confusion and puzzlement, turns his full attention toward the formidable mounted machine gun, gripping it with a firm determination that suggests both anxiety and readiness. With furrowed brows, he retrieves his watch, examining it with a focus so intense that it almost breathes life into the ticking hands. Meanwhile, Indy, employing his arm as an improvised directional indicator, makes an animated gesture to clarify that his intent is to point toward a specific direction rather than suggesting any particular time. Complying with clarity, Henry shifts his gaze and alignment according to the indicated direction. In that very moment, the machine gun bursts forth with a dramatic surge of energy, nearly unseating him as one of the agile and elusive Messerschmitts comes into his line of sight. With determined resolve, Henry pulls back on the trigger, unleashing a relentless stream of gunfire from the machine gun. The targeted Messerschmitt executes a sharp left banking maneuver, yet Henry, with remarkable composure, continues to track it within his aim. In a moment of inadvertence, Henry swings the gun around with considerable force, while Indy, his face marked with concern, glances back to assess the situation regarding the absent tail section, then directs his worried gaze toward his father. As the airplane begins its perilous descent, Indy grapples with the controls, battling to regain stability and control over the rapidly descending aircraft, until, at last, the wheels make contact with the ground. Spiraling out of control, the plane skids wildly across the terrain, crashing into a corral that houses unsuspecting goats, and then advances into the farmhouse just beyond, generating a massive cloud of dust that ascends into the air like a mushroom plume.

Amidst the chaos, Indy pulls himself from the cockpit with haste, surrounded by a storm of gunfire and bullets that explode unpredictably around them. Both Indy and Henry leap energetically over a sturdy stone barricade, seeking urgent cover. Henry, visibly shaken and frightened, clings to Indy for reassurance, as an elderly man comes into view, kneeling beside his car with a focused diligence, engaged in the task of repairing a rear tire. Holding the hubcap in his hands, the man's concentration is suddenly disturbed as the wheel rolls forward unexpectedly, stealing his attention. Indy, filled with determination and urgency, thrusts the throttle downward, his hands gripping the steering wheel with intense focus, while Henry remains a very nervous and apprehensive passenger beside him. In the side mirror, Indy spots a low-flying Messerschmitt approaching from behind, its presence confirmed by the roar overhead and the bullets that explode dangerously close by, intentionally yet narrowly missing the car. The vehicle hurtles toward a tunnel carved into a steep path, the Messerschmitt bearing menacingly down on them, its machine guns firing with relentless fury. However, at the critical last moment, Indy expertly guides the car into the tunnel. The Messerschmitt, unable to adjust its trajectory in time, slams violently into the tunnel's mouth, its wings shearing off with a thunderous impact. What remains of the flaming fuselage rockets through the tunnel's confined space like a bullet forcefully expelled from the barrel of a gun, sparks igniting as it scrapes against both the pavement and the enclosing walls of the tunnel.

Quickly, Indy and Henry’s heads turn, glancing over their shoulders with eyes widening in alarm as the wingless ball of fire speeds toward them, threatening to overtake their vehicle with destructive intent. The car, maintaining its top speed, bursts out of the tunnel, swerving off the road in the nick of time as the blazing fuselage of the Messerschmitt shoots past them, exploding with magnificent force in the middle of the road. Emerging from the fiery inferno unscathed, Henry takes a moment to wipe the sweat from his brow, a gesture of immense relief, and looks out through the windshield, only to be met by the sight of another Messerschmitt, diving aggressively from the sky towards them. This advancing Messerschmitt releases a single bomb from its under-fuselage, which detonates with a deafening explosion on the road just ahead of the car, missing them by a matter of mere feet. In the aftermath, the car plunges into the crater created by the bomb, and within its confines, Indy climbs out to face the next challenge and turns back towards Henry.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Henry, with a perplexed expression on his face, turns and reaches out with both hands to firmly grip the mounted machine gun. He hesitates for a moment and then pulls out his watch, peering at it with confusion. Meanwhile, Indy uses his arm to point emphatically, illustrating that he is indicating a direction rather than referencing a time. Henry, processing this clarification, adjusts his aim accordingly, and the sudden recoil of the exploding gun almost throws him out of his seat. His body jolts as the Messerschmidt comes into his gun sight, and with determination, he pulls back on the trigger, unleashing a rapid succession of gunfire. The Messerschmidt attempts to evade by banking to the left, but Henry, concentrating intensely, manages to keep it in his sight. As he inadvertently swings the gun around, Indy quickly glances back over his shoulder at the critical absence of their plane's tail section, then shifts his gaze back to his father. The plane, losing control, begins its ominous descent, and Indy, with both hands gripping the controls tightly, struggles to manage the plane's trajectory until the wheels finally make contact with the ground. The plane skids uncontrollably across the surface, first crashing into a crowded corral of goats, which scatter in frenzy, before ramming into the farmhouse beyond. The impact sends a thick cloud of dust billowing into the air. Quickly, Indy extricates himself from the cockpit as the air fills with the deafening sound of gunfire and the sharp, dangerous snap of bullets exploding nearby. He and Henry swiftly leap over a stone barricade, seeking cover. Henry, visibly frightened, reaches out and clings to Indy for reassurance. Nearby, an old man, absorbed in the task of repairing a rear tire on his car, kneels by the wheel with a hubcap in his hands. Abruptly, he is startled as the wheel lurches forward unexpectedly. In the car, Indy pushes the throttle down hard, his knuckles white from the firm grip on the steering wheel, while Henry sits beside him, his nerves on edge. Indy catches sight of a low-flying Messerschmidt approaching rapidly from behind in the side mirror. As it roars overhead, a barrage of bullets erupt around them, barely missing the car. The vehicle speeds toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep mountainside, with the Messerschmidt aggressively pursuing and its machine guns firing relentlessly. Just as the car enters the sanctuary of the tunnel, the Messerschmidt, unable to pull up in time, collides with the tunnel's entrance, tearing its wings asunder. The flaming fuselage continues its relentless trajectory, careening through the tunnel like a fiery projectile, sending sparks flying as it scrapes against the pavement and tunnel walls. Indy and Henry instinctively glance over their shoulders, apprehension etched on their faces, as the blazing, wingless wreckage threatens to overtake them. At top speed, the car bursts from the tunnel, swerving off the road as the fiery fuselage races past and detonates in a spectacular explosion on the road behind them. Emerging from the inferno unscathed, Henry reflexively wipes the sweat from his brow and peers out through the windshield, only to witness a second Messerschmidt descending swiftly from the sky toward them. The aircraft releases its single under-fuselage bomb, which detonates spectacularly on the road directly ahead of them, missing the car by mere feet. The resulting crater swallows the car, and in the aftermath, Indy climbs out from the bomb crater and turns back to face Henry, ready to regroup and face whatever may come next.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Henry grips the mounted machine gun with confusion and checks his watch, while Indy clarifies that he's indicating a direction. Following this, Henry fires at a Messerschmidt, maintaining his aim despite the forceful recoil. As the plane loses control and descends, Indy struggles to manage the landing, ultimately crashing into a goat corral and farmhouse, enveloping the area in dust. Amidst gunfire, Indy and Henry leap over a stone barricade for cover. Meanwhile, they alarm an old man repairing a car tire when the wheel suddenly shifts. With urgency, Indy accelerates the car, steering intently, as a Messerschmidt approaches from behind and narrowly misses them with machine gun fire. Entering a tunnel just in time, the pursuing Messerschmidt crashes at its entrance, losing its wings. The flaming fuselage hurtles through the tunnel after them, scraping against the surfaces. Exiting at full speed, the car avoids the explosion of the Messerschmidt behind them. After escaping the fiery wreckage, Henry wipes sweat from his brow, only to witness another Messerschmidt approaching. It drops a bomb ahead of them, creating a crater that the car falls into. Indy climbs out and turns back to check on Henry.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Henry turns and grips the mounted machine gun with a perplexed expression, reminiscent of someone unfamiliar with operating such a weapon, and then pulls out his watch. Indy, whose full name is Indiana Jones and is known for his adventures as an archaeologist, uses his arm to demonstrate that he's referring to a direction and not a time. Henry does as indicated, and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts, German fighter planes used extensively in World War II, in his sight. He pulls back on the trigger, causing the machine gun to fire repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left, but Henry, despite his inexperience, keeps it in his gun sight. Henry inadvertently swings the gun around, while Indy looks back at the missing tail section of their own plane, then at his father. The plane begins to go down, and Indy, who has piloted various types of aircraft in his past escapades, struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control, the plane skids and crashes first into a corral of goats, likely a farm staple in the rural European setting, and then into the farmhouse beyond, sending a cloud of dust into the air. Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as guns blaze and bullets explode around them; Indy and Henry jump over a stone barricade, typical in such countryside environments. Henry, frightened by the chaos, grabs at Indy as an old man, likely a local farmer, kneels at his car repairing a rear tire. The man turns to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands, and suddenly the wheel moves forward, startling him. Indy has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel, while Henry is a very nervous passenger. Indy sees a low-flying Messerschmidt coming up behind him in the side mirror, and as it roars by overhead, bullets explode around them, narrowly missing the car. The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep, likely mountainous, terrain, and the Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car with machine guns firing, but the car enters the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel, shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun, with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames, Henry wipes the sweat from his brow, a testament to the intense ordeal they've just survived, and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single under-fuselage bomb, a tactic used to disable vehicles on the ground, which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb, and Indy climbs out, still in the bomb crater, and turns back to Henry.

Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry.

Indy uses his arm to demonstrate that he is referring to a direction and not a time. Henry does as indicated and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight. He pulls back on the trigger causing the machine gun to fire repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left but Henry keeps it in his gun sight. Henry inadvertently swings the gun around while Indy looks back at the missing tail section then at his father. The plane begins to go down and Indy struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control the plane skids and crashes first into a corral of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond sending a cloud of dust into the air. Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as guns blaze and bullets explode around them. Indy and Henry jump over a stone barricade. Henry frightened grabs at Indy as an old man kneels at his car repairing a rear tire. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. The man turns to the wheel the hubcap in his hands and suddenly the wheel moves forward startling him. Indy has the throttle down both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel while Henry is a very nervous passenger. Indy sees a lowflying Messerschmidt coming up behind him in the side mirror and as it roars by overhead bullets explode around them narrowly missing the car. The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep and the Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car with machine guns firing but the car enters the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single underfuselage bomb which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry.

Henry does as indicated and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight. Henry inadvertently swings the gun around while Indy looks back at the missing tail section then at his father. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single underfuselage bomb which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry.

Indy uses his arm to demonstrate that he is referring to a direction and not a time. As the car emerges safely from the flames Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single underfuselage bomb which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Bobby turns and grips the mounted machine gun with a perplexed expression and then pulls out his watch. Sarah uses her arm to demonstrate that she's referring to a direction and not a time. Bobby does as indicated, and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight. He pulls back on the trigger, causing the machine gun to fire repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left, but Bobby keeps it in his gun sight. Bobby inadvertently swings the gun around, while Sarah looks back at the missing tail section, then at her sister. The plane begins to go down, and Sarah struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control, the plane skids and crashes first into a corral of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond, sending a cloud of dust into the air. Sarah pulls herself from the cockpit as guns blaze and bullets explode around them; Sarah and Bobby jump over a stone barricade. Bobby, frightened, grabs at Sarah as a young girl kneels at her car repairing a rear tire. The girl turns to the wheel, the hubcap in her hands, and suddenly the wheel moves forward, startling her. Sarah has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel, while Bobby is a very nervous passenger. Sarah sees a low-flying Messerschmidt coming up behind her in the side mirror, and as it roars by overhead, bullets explode around them, narrowly missing the car. The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep, and the Messerschmidt bears down on Sarah's car with machine guns firing, but the car enters the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel, shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun, with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Sarah and Bobby look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the flames, Bobby wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single under-fuselage bomb, which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet. The car falls into the hole made by the bomb, and Sarah climbs out, still in the bomb crater, and turns back to Bobby.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Henry turns and grips the mounted slingshot with a perplexed expression and then pulls out his compass. Indy uses his elbow to demonstrate that he's referring to a direction and not a time. Henry does as indicated, and the exploding slingshot nearly shakes him out of his bench as he has one of the hot air balloons in his sight. He pulls back on the cord, causing the slingshot to fire repeatedly as the hot air balloon drifts to the left, but Henry keeps it in his sling sight. Henry inadvertently swings the slingshot around, while Indy looks back at the missing flagpole section, then at his father. The carriage begins to go down, and Indy struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control, the carriage skids and crashes first into a field of daisies and then into the barn beyond, sending a cloud of straw into the air. Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as fireworks blaze and sparklers explode around them; Indy and Henry jump over a wooden barricade. Henry, frightened, grabs at Indy as an old man kneels at his bike repairing a front tire. The man turns to the pedal, the bell in his hands, and suddenly the pedal moves forward, startling him. Indy has the throttle down, both hands tightly gripping the oars, while Henry is a very nervous passenger. Indy sees a low-flying hot air balloon coming up behind him in the side mirror, and as it drifts by overhead, sparklers explode around them, narrowly missing the carriage. The carriage races toward a cave that cuts through a hill, and the hot air balloon bears down on Indy's carriage with fireworks firing, but the carriage enters the cave. The hot air balloon cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the cave, shearing off its basket. The flaming canopy continues to rocket through the cave like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun, with sparks flying as its sides scrapes against the walls and the ceiling of the cave. Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the basketless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The carriage exits the cave at top speed and veers off the path as the flaming hot air balloon canopy shoots past and explodes in the middle of the path. As the carriage emerges safely from the sparks, Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second hot air balloon screaming out of the sky toward them. The hot air balloon drops its single under-canopy smoke bomb, which explodes in the path directly ahead of the carriage, missing it by only several feet. The carriage falls into the hole made by the smoke bomb, and Indy climbs out, still in the smoke crater, and turns back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Henry spins and examines the mounted machine gun with a puzzled expression and then checks his compass. Indy uses his arm to indicate that he's pointing to a location and not a time. Henry follows the gesture, and the malfunctioning gun nearly propels him out of his seat as he notices one of the Messerschmidts in his view. He pushes on the trigger, causing the machine gun to jam repeatedly as the Messerschmidt turns to the left, but Henry keeps it in his field of vision. Henry accidentally tilts the gun upward, while Indy glances back at the missing tail section, then at his father. The plane begins to rise, and Indy struggles to control its ascent until the wheels lift off. Out of control, the plane spins and collides first with a herd of goats and then with the farmhouse beyond, sending a flock of birds into the air. Indy extracts himself from the cockpit as fireworks ignite and confetti bursts around them; Indy and Henry leap over a stone barricade. Henry, terrified, clings to Indy as an old man crouches at his car adjusting a rear mirror. The man turns to the wheel, the hubcap in his hands, and suddenly the wheel rolls backward, startling him. Indy has the brakes applied, both hands loosely holding the steering wheel, while Henry is a very anxious passenger. Indy sees a low-flying Messerschmidt approaching from behind in the side mirror, and as it zips past overhead, fireworks pop around them, nearly hitting the car. The car accelerates toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep, and the Messerschmidt swoops down on Indy's car with horns blaring, but the car enters the tunnel. The Messerschmidt cannot ascend in time and smashes into the mouth of the tunnel, clipping its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to glide through the tunnel like a feather down the muzzle of a gun, with embers flying as its belly skims against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel. Indy and Henry glance over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire drifting toward them, about to overtake them. The car exits the tunnel at top speed and swerves off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage coasts past and erupts in the middle of the road. As the car emerges safely from the embers, Henry dabs the sweat from his brow and gazes out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt diving out of the sky toward them. The Messerschmidt drops its single under-fuselage balloon, which bursts on the road directly ahead of the car, missing it by only several feet. The car slides into the hole made by the balloon, and Indy scrambles out, still in the crater, and turns back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The raccoon turns and grips the mounted blender with a perplexed expression and then pulls out its spatula. Aardvark uses its leg to demonstrate that it's referring to a direction and not a time. The raccoon does as indicated, and the exploding blender nearly shakes it out of its hammock as it has one of the flamingos in its sight. It pulls back on the lever, causing the blender to fire repeatedly as the flamingo banks to the left, but the raccoon keeps it in its blender sight. The raccoon inadvertently swings the blender around, while aardvark looks back at the missing hat section, then at its walnut. The kayak begins to go down, and aardvark struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down. Out of control, the kayak skids and crashes first into a bouquet of balloons and then into the aquarium beyond, sending a cloud of confetti into the air. Aardvark pulls itself from the pouch as toasters blaze and acorns explode around them; aardvark and raccoon jump over a stone hammock. The raccoon, frightened, grabs at aardvark as a teapot kneels at its pillow repairing a rear sneaker. The teapot turns to the sneaker, the shoelace in its hands, and suddenly the sneaker moves forward, startling it. Aardvark has the flashlight down, both hands tightly gripping the hula hoop, while the raccoon is a very nervous passenger. Aardvark sees a low-flying flamingo coming up behind it in the side mirror, and as it roars by overhead, acorns explode around them, narrowly missing the hula hoop. The hula hoop races toward a mailbox that cuts through a steep, and the flamingo bears down on aardvark's hula hoop with blenders firing, but the hula hoop enters the mailbox. The flamingo cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the mailbox, shearing off its wings. The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the mailbox like an egg down the muzzle of a toboggan, with sparkles flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the mailbox. Aardvark and raccoon look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The hula hoop exits the mailbox at top speed and veers off the track as the flaming flamingo fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the track. As the hula hoop emerges safely from the flames, the raccoon wipes the syrup from its nose and looks out the window to see a second flamingo screaming out of the stadium toward them. The flamingo drops its single under-fuselage pumpkin, which explodes in the track directly ahead of the hula hoop, missing it by only several feet. The hula hoop falls into the gap made by the pumpkin, and aardvark climbs out, still in the pumpkin crater, and turns back to the raccoon.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Elena pivots and clutches the mounted telescope with a bewildered expression and then flips open her locket. Sarah uses her hand to illustrate that she's pointing to a landmark and not a time. Elena follows the gesture, and the shaking telescope nearly tips her out of her perch as she has one of the windmills in her view. She presses on the button, causing the telescope to adjust repeatedly as the windmill spins to the left, but Elena maintains it in her viewfinder. Elena accidentally swivels the telescope around, while Sarah glances back at the missing rudder, then at her friend. The ship begins to tilt, and Sarah struggles to steady its path until the sails catch wind. Out of direction, the ship drifts and collides first into a herd of sheep and then into the barn beyond, sending a cloud of straw into the air. Sarah pulls herself from the helm as bells chime and echoes ring around them; Sarah and Elena dash over a wooden barricade. Elena, anxious, clutches at Sarah as a young boy crouches at his bike adjusting a rear light. The boy turns to the wheel, the reflector in his hands, and suddenly the wheel spins forward, surprising him. Sarah has the accelerator pressed, both hands firmly gripping the handlebars, while Elena is a very uneasy passenger. Sarah notices a low-flying drone approaching behind her in the rearview mirror, and as it zips by overhead, lights flash around them, narrowly avoiding the bike. The bike speeds toward a bridge that cuts across a valley, and the drone descends upon Sarah's bike with lights beaming, but the bike enters the bridge. The drone cannot ascend in time and crashes into the entrance of the bridge, losing its propellers. The blazing shell continues to zoom through the bridge like a comet down a tunnel, with sparks flying as its frame scrapes against the ground and the sides of the bridge. Sarah and Elena glance over their shoulders to see the propeller-less streak of fire approaching them, about to overtake them. The bike exits the bridge at maximum speed and swerves off the path as the fiery drone shell zips past and detonates in the center of the path. As the bike emerges safely from the fire, Elena dabs the moisture from her forehead and looks out the windshield to see a second drone plummeting from the sky toward them. The drone releases its single under-frame flare, which bursts on the path directly ahead of the bike, missing it by only several inches. The bike topples into the gap created by the flare, and Sarah climbs out, still in the crater, and turns back to Elena.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Henry swivels and clutches the mounted telescope with a puzzled expression and then takes out his compass. Indy uses his arm to illustrate that he's pointing to a landmark and not a street. Henry follows as indicated, and the vibrating telescope nearly tilts him out of his chair as he spots one of the seagulls in his view. He presses down on the lever, causing the telescope to zoom repeatedly as the seagull glides to the left, but Henry keeps it in view. Henry accidentally rotates the telescope, while Indy glances back at the absent tail fin, then at his father. The aircraft begins to ascend, and Indy struggles to control its climb until the skids touch down. Out of control, the aircraft scrapes and crashes first into a pen of sheep and then into the barn beyond, sending a swirl of feathers into the air. Indy drags himself from the cockpit as lights flash and sparks erupt around them; Indy and Henry leap over a wooden fence. Henry, terrified, clutches at Indy as an old man squats at his cart fixing a front wheel. The man turns to the tire, the wrench in his hands, and suddenly the tire rolls forward, surprising him. Indy has the lever down, both hands tightly clutching the steering wheel, while Henry is an extremely anxious traveler. Indy sees a low-flying hawk approaching from behind in the side window, and as it screeches by overhead, sparks erupt around them, narrowly missing the cart. The cart hurtles toward a bridge that cuts through a canyon, and the hawk swoops down on Indy's cart with talons extended, but the cart enters the bridge. The hawk cannot ascend in time and crashes into the entrance of the bridge, tearing off its feathers. The blazing hull continues to soar through the bridge like a pebble through a tube, with embers flying as its body scrapes against the dirt and the sides of the bridge. Indy and Henry glance over their shoulders to see the featherless comet of fire gaining on them, about to overtake them. The cart exits the bridge at full speed and swerves off the path as the blazing hawk hull shoots past and detonates in the middle of the path. As the cart emerges safely from the embers, Henry wipes the dirt from his face and gazes out the windshield to see a second hawk diving out of the clouds toward them. The hawk releases its solitary underbody package, which detonates in the path directly ahead of the cart, missing it by only several yards. The cart dips into the hole made by the package, and Indy climbs out, still in the crater, and turns back to Henry.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Oliver pivots and clutches the mounted water cannon with a bewildered expression and then extracts his compass. Max utilizes his leg to illustrate that he's pointing to a destination and not a place. Oliver follows as suggested, and the erupting water cannon nearly jolts him out of his hammock as he has one of the pelicans in his lens. He pushes forward on the lever, causing the water cannon to spray repeatedly as the pelican veers to the right, but Oliver keeps it in his lens. Oliver unintentionally swivels the cannon around, while Max glances back at the missing sail section, then at his brother. The boat starts to drift down, and Max struggles to maintain its path until the anchor drops. Out of balance, the boat skims and crashes first into a pen of sheep and then into the barn beyond, sending a puff of hay into the sky. Max pulls himself from the cabin as fireworks crack and confetti explodes around them; Max and Oliver leap over a wooden fence. Oliver, alarmed, clutches at Max as an elderly woman squats at her bicycle fixing a front pedal. The woman turns to the pedal, the basket in her hands, and suddenly the pedal rotates backward, surprising her. Max has the gears set, both legs firmly pedaling the handlebars, while Oliver is a very anxious rider. Max sees a high-flying kite soaring above him in the rearview mirror, and as it whooshes by overhead, confetti bursts around them, narrowly missing the bicycle. The bicycle zooms toward a bridge that cuts through a gorge, and the kite bears down on Max's bicycle with ribbons streaming, but the bicycle enters the bridge. The kite cannot rise in time and crashes into the entrance of the bridge, shredding its strings. The blazing frame continues to zip through the bridge like a dart down a corridor, with ribbons trailing as its frame scrapes against the wooden planks and the sides of the bridge. Max and Oliver glance over their elbows to see the stringless frame of flames closing in on them, about to surpass them. The bicycle exits the bridge at full speed and swerves off the path as the flaming kite frame zooms past and detonates in the center of the path. As the bicycle emerges unscathed from the flames, Oliver dabs the perspiration from his forehead and looks out the visor to see a second kite diving out of the clouds toward them. The kite releases its lone under-frame ornament, which bursts on the path just ahead of the bicycle, missing it by only several inches. The bicycle tumbles into the divot made by the ornament, and Max climbs out, still in the ornament crater, and turns back to Oliver.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Henry turns to a mounted machine gun with confusion, before Indy signals him to aim rather than check the time. Henry fires at a Messerschmidt, nearly being shaken out of position. The plane struggles and lands roughly, crashing into a goat corral and a farmhouse. Indy and Henry escape the cockpit under gunfire, seeking cover behind a stone barricade. Indy speeds away in a car with Henry as a nervous passenger, narrowly dodging bullets from a pursuing Messerschmidt. Entering a tunnel, the plane crashes at the entrance, and its wingless fuselage follows them inside, sparking against the walls. Exiting the tunnel, they avoid the flaming wreck as a second Messerschmidt appears. It releases a bomb that creates a crater in their path, narrowly missing them. Indy climbs out of the car, now in the crater, and turns back to Henry.

Messerschmidt banks to the left but Henry keeps it in his gun sight The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Indy has the throttle down both hands tightly gripping the steering wheel while Henry is a very nervous passenger Indy sees a lowflying Messerschmidt coming up behind him in the side mirror and as it roars by overhead bullets explode around them narrowly missing the car The car races toward a tunnel that cuts through a steep and the Messerschmidt bears down on Indy's car with machine guns firing but the car enters the tunnel The Messerschmidt cannot pull up in time and slams into the mouth of the tunnel shearing off its wings The flaming fuselage continues to rocket through the tunnel like a bullet down the muzzle of a gun with sparks flying as its belly scrapes against the pavement and the sides of the tunnel Indy and Henry look over their shoulders to see the wingless ball of fire gaining on them about to overtake them The car exits the tunnel at top speed and veers off the road as the flaming Messerschmidt fuselage shoots past and explodes in the middle of the road As the car emerges safely from the flames Henry wipes the sweat from his brow and looks out the windshield to see a second Messerschmidt screaming out of the sky toward them The Messerschmidt drops its single underfuselage bomb which explodes in the road directly ahead of the car missing it by only several feet The car falls into the hole made by the bomb and Indy climbs out still in the bomb crater and turns back to Henry Henry turns and grips the mounted machine gun with a perplexed expression and then pulls out his watch Indy uses his arm to demonstrate that he is referring to a direction and not a time Henry does as indicated and the exploding gun nearly shakes him out of his seat as he has one of the Messerschmidts in his sight He pulls back on the trigger causing the machine gun to fire repeatedly as the Messerschmidt banks to the left but Henry keeps it in his gun sight Henry inadvertently swings the gun around while Indy looks back at the missing tail section then at his father The plane begins to go down and Indy struggles to control its descent until the wheels touch down Out of control the plane skids and crashes first into a corral of goats and then into the farmhouse beyond sending a cloud of dust into the air Indy pulls himself from the cockpit as guns blaze and bullets explode around them Indy and Henry jump over a stone barricade Henry frightened grabs at Indy as an old man kneels at his car repairing a rear tire The man turns to the wheel the hubcap in his hands and suddenly the wheel moves forward startling him
